references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: What five aircraft documents are required to be carried by NZ-registered aircraft operating in New Zealand?
questions.answer: Airworthiness certificate (some exceptions). Flight manual. Weight and balance (form CAA 2173 or equivalent). Radio Station Equipment Approval Levels (form CAA 2129). Technical log (some exceptions).

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.111 - Documents to be carried)

questions.question: What two additional aircraft documents must be carried for a NZ-registered aircraft operation overseas?
questions.answer: General User Radio License. Current certificate of registration.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.111(4) - Documents to be carried)

questions.question: What three additional aircraft documents must be carried for a foreign aircraft operating within New Zealand?
questions.answer: Current certificate of registration. Written evidence that the aircraft meets aircraft noise level compliance. Written evidence the aircraft meets engine emission compliance.

references.text: CAR Part 91 (91.111(5) - Documents to be carried)
